channel.description: Recent content in Astrophysics on Guttulous L∞ps

item.title: Working with the CNRS
item.description: As of December 2013, I’ll be working for the IRAP (Astrophysics and Planetary Science Institute), doing software design, code migration, data treatment and manipulation for MUSE (Multi-Unit Spectroscopic Explorer). We’ll be using this data to study galaxies, galactic winds, and overall for serendipity. MUSE is the product of nine years of hard work from hundreds of people around the world, and I have the good fortune to pitch in at the payroll.
